intro: Wuacanthus, commonly known as the Mexican woad, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from blue to purple. Wuacanthus has been used traditionally for its dye-producing properties, particularly for making indigo dye. Its leaves are ovate and often have a rough texture, while its stems are hairy and robust.
